basejump 0.5.3
  • Reference

Detect Organism

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/methods-detectOrganism.R
detectOrganism.Rd

Supports organism detection from genome build or Ensembl identifier.

detectOrganism(object, ...)

# S4 method for character
detectOrganism(object, unique = FALSE)

# S4 method for factor
detectOrganism(object, unique = FALSE)

# S4 method for matrix
detectOrganism(object)

# S4 method for data.frame
detectOrganism(object)

# S4 method for DataFrame
detectOrganism(object)

# S4 method for dgCMatrix
detectOrganism(object)

# S4 method for tbl_df
detectOrganism(object)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
unique

Only return unique matching organisms. Applies to character vector input.

Value

Full latin organism name. Stops on detection failure.

  • atomic: Named character vector containing organism name or NA for individual match failures (e.g. spike-ins like EGFP, TDTOMATO).

  • dim: Unique character vector of the organism(s) detected. Warns if multiple organisms are detected.

Details

Currently supported organisms:

  • Homo sapiens (human)

  • Mus musculus (mouse)

  • Rattus norvegicus (rat)

  • Danio rerio (zebrafish)

  • Drosophila melanogaster (fruitfly)

  • Caenorhabditis elegans (roundworm)

  • Saccharomyces cerevisiae (yeast)

  • Gallus gallus (chicken)

  • Ovis aries (sheep)

See also

Other Gene Annotation Functions: annotable, broadClass, convertGenesToSymbols, convertTranscriptsToGenes, convertUCSCBuildToEnsembl, emptyRanges, hgnc2gene, makeGRangesFromEnsembl, makeGRangesFromGFF, makeGene2symbolFromEnsembl, makeGene2symbolFromGFF, makeTx2geneFromEnsembl, makeTx2geneFromGFF, mgi2gene, panther, parseGFFAttributes, stripTranscriptVersions

Examples

# By gene identifier
detectOrganism("ENSG00000000003")
#> [1] "Homo sapiens"
detectOrganism(c("ENSG00000000003", "EGFP", "TDTOMATO"))
#> ENSG00000000003            EGFP        TDTOMATO 
#>  "Homo sapiens"              NA              NA 

# By genome build
detectOrganism("GRCh38")  # Ensembl
#> [1] "Homo sapiens"
detectOrganism("hg38")    # UCSC
#> [1] "Homo sapiens"

# By alternate organism name
detectOrganism("H. sapiens")
#> [1] "Homo sapiens"
detectOrganism("hsapiens")
#> [1] "Homo sapiens"
